newsitem.title: UK: UK internet firm can access Reuters data - FT.
newsitem.headline: UK internet firm can access Reuters data - FT.

text.p: UK internet company Display.IT has developed software which allows users to access Reuters Holdings Plc data without directly connecting to Reuters' proprietary network, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.
The report said at least one investment bank was testing the system.
"We have no agreement with this company for the display of Reuters data," the FT quoted Reuters as saying. "It is therefore difficult to imagine how the company can disseminate our proprietary data."
The newspaper said buyers of Display.IT software would still have to pay for data from Reuters but would be able to bypass Reuters hardware more easily.
As well as supplying price data, news and transaction services, Reuters also markets trading room systems.
